intro: Pasania proboscidea, commonly known as the proboscideous pasania, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a distinctive elongated spur. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
